blurb.content: Hurl your shield or weapon as a discus with irrepressible force.

subcontent.content: Attack target is weakened and shoved 1.
A different foe in range 3 from your target is shoved 1 away from your main target.

blurb.content: Use your shield, weapon, or armored fist and send your target flying.

subcontent.content: An adjacent character is shoved 2 spaces.
Foe is slashed, and refund the action cost of this ability.

blurb.content: Crash your greatshield or weapon into the earth, sending up devastating shockwaves.

subcontent.content: Shove all characters in the area except you 1 space away from your attack target, then, shove your target 1.
Gains True Strike and becomes Burst 2 (target).

blurb.content: Stride forth, with your shield held before you, battering aside foes.

subcontent.content: Rush 1, then rush 1. After each rush, shove all adjacent characters 1.
Rush 1 again, then shove all adjacent characters 1.

blurb.content: The land itself is your castle, and you will never let its walls be breached. No matter where your allies step, your shield will be there.

subcontent.content: When you enter this stance, or when it refreshes, choose an ally in range. Gain the following interrupt:
Refresh this stance at the start of your turn.

blurb.content: Use your shield as a springboard to set up ally maneuvers or to deflect projectiles.

subcontent.content: An ally ends a movement in an adjacent space.
Shove that ally 2 in any direction.
That ally gains 2 vigor and may rush 1.

blurb.content: Your armor and shield become a mirror, channeling and amplifying the destructive power of your allies’ attacks.

subcontent.content: You are included in an allied area effect.

You release an aura 1 effect centered on you that lasts for the duration of the triggering ability, extending the area effect to encompass the aura. You can choose to be immune to any part of the triggering ability.

blurb.content: Your stance is powerful as you strike, and stand tall, an armored sentinel. No enemy can safely set foot where your gaze falls.

subcontent.content: You gain aura 1 until the end of your next turn. Any foe in the aura that is shoved is shoved +1. If any foe ends their turn in the aura, you may deal fray damage to them and shove them 1.
Gains true strike, and increase aura to aura 2.

blurb.content: You call a challenge to your foe to stand and fight. Cowards are blown away by your massive charge.

subcontent.content: Choose a foe in range 3, then end your turn. At the end of that foe’s turn, you may rush 4, as long as you end each space of your movement closer to them from when you started (if you are adjacent, you don’t move at all). Then, if your foe is adjacent, they are shoved a number of spaces equal to the spaces you just moved, then take damage equal to that number +2.
Foe also gains hatred of you after this ability resolves.

blurb.content: You slash your weapon in a deadly swing sending cutting shockwaves out that rip through enemy defenses.

subcontent.content: Gains range 2, and repeat the area effect in a new line 3 area in range. The areas cannot overlap.

blurb.content: Your weapon becomes like a meteor, burning through the air as you hurl at at your foes and smash it into the earth.

subcontent.content: fter throwing your weapon, it becomes an object placed in the center space of the area, or as close as possible.

blurb.content: Fill the air with the flurry of blades.

subcontent.content: You may rush 1, then target another small blast area in range 3 with
fray damage. The areas cannot overlap.
Gains true strike, and may repeat the effect.

blurb.content: With a clap, you deflect a weapon or projectile with your bare hand or the flat edge of your blade.

subcontent.content: A foe uses an ability that targets an ally in range, and damage to your ally has been determined on the foe’s end but not applied yet.
Apply the damage to both you and your ally, but both of you gain resistance to it, and are sturdy against its effects.
Gain vigor 4 after this ability resolves.

blurb.content: Even unarmed, a Demon Slayer can employ ferocious strength and unleash blows with their bare hands that can crumple steel.

subcontent.content: Rush 1, then rush 1. Each time, you may deal 2 damage to an adjacent foe. Foes can only be damaged once per use of this ability.
If you didn’t attack on your turn before using this ability, it deals damage to all adjacent foes.
Weaken all adjacent characters after the first or second rush.

blurb.content: You move so quickly that even your afterimages are capable of deflecting blows.

subcontent.content: Gain +1 vigilance. Until the start of your next turn, you gain counter, and may rush 2 after activating vigilance. This effect can trigger any number of times a round, but only once a turn.

blurb.content: You imbue your weapon with aether, causing additional cuts at the very aether of your foe.

subcontent.content: When entering this stance, gain a d6 power die, starting at 2.

description.content: • When you attack, you can tick the die down by any amount to cause an additional aether slash as a line 3 area effect that must include your target, after the attack resolves. The area has true strike. Foes in the area take damage equal to the amount you ticked down.
• If you tick the die down by 3 or more, you also gain vigor equal to the number on the die.
• If you tick the die down by 6, the slash deals +3 more total damage and grants you +3 more total vigor.
• If the die goes to 0, you exit this stance.

subcontent.content: Gain +1 tick on the die for every adjacent foe when you enter this stance.
This stance refreshes if you end a turn without attacking, or if you start a slow turn.

blurb.content: Using dark arts, you summon up a sliver of the demon world, blocking out a dark arena that traps enemies in its web.

subcontent.content: Mark out a burst 2 (self) area, then gain
Your next turn must be slow, but at the start of that turn, the trigram activates.

description.content: • When the trigram activates, all foes inside are weakened.

• While active, any foes that attempt to exit the terrain effect during any turn must first pass a save, or become unable to do so until the start of their next turn. If they are moving, they don’t lose their movement but can’t consider the area outside valid space to move to.
• This area lasts until this ability is used again.

subcontent.content: The area has rampart and foes in the area when it activates take fray damage.

blurb.content: The master art of the demon slayers - holding a single blow with ultimate patience, until it can slay the most tenebrous of monsters in one stroke.

subcontent.content: After you attack, your weapon becomes charged with energy. At the start of each round, gain a d4 power die at 1, or tick it up by 1. For each tick of the die:

description.content: • Increase the base damage on hit of Wicked Sheath by [D] and the shove by 1.
Discard the power die after you hit with any attack.

subcontent.content: You may also rush 1 before making the attack once for each charge on the die.

blurb.content: Soaring through the air like a vengeful spirit, you crash into your enemy.

subcontent.content: Create a pit under your target.

blurb.content: The disciples of the wolf titan exhibit such legendary strength that they can rip up the earth itself with their bare hands.

subcontent.content: Smash the battlefield, creating a height 1 boulder object in free space in range. Adjacent characters are shoved 1 away from the terrain when it appears.
Create difficult terrain underneath any character shoved by this ability.
Sacrifice 6. An adjacent foe takes [D] + Fray damage.
You may rush 2 before or after using this ability.
Your next attack strikes with such force that it deals bonus damage and creates a pit under its target after it resolves.
If your target was already in a pit before the triggering attack, it also activates all exceed effects.
Attack may also create a small blast area effect on its target, dealing 2 damage to all characters inside.

blurb.content: You deliver a mighty blow with wild abandon, so strong that you yourself are left reeling.

subcontent.content: Both you and your foe are stunned. You may sacrifice 4 to avoid this stun.
Gains true strike and creates a pit under your target.

blurb.content: Wrapping your arms around your foe, you fling the two of you backwards with a force that liquifies rock.

subcontent.content: You pick up an adjacent foe, removing them from the battlefield.

Sacrifice up to 6, then fly half that many spaces. Place your foe in a free adjacent space. They take [D] + fray damage and are slashed. Slashed characters are stunned. If you can’t place the foe in a valid space this action can’t be taken.
Sacrifice cost costs 0 hp but counts as sacrificing 6.

blurb.content: You fling your foe into a wall, catching them on the rebound.

subcontent.content: You bounce your foe, then and catch them mid air. Remove them from the battlefield, fly 1, then place them in any free adjacent space. They take fray damage.
Smash the ground when you land, creating difficult terrain under your foe and in two adjacent spaces.

blurb.content: You deliver a spectacular series of wild, rising blows. Like a cornered animal, your strength becomes greater the more of your blood spills.

subcontent.content: This ability has no effect if you are not bloodied.
Gain additional effects depending on your current hp. Each effect stacks and takes place in order:
You may rush 1, then deal fray damage to an adjacent foe. That foe is slashed.
You may fly 1, then shove all adjacent foes 1.
Become unstoppable and immune to all damage while using this ability.
If you are defeated, your next use of this ability in the same combat becomes a free action.

blurb.content: Colossi can lash out with the last of their strength, using the heat and strength of their body to punish their foes before expiring.
Hit them right in the gronch.

subcontent.content: Foe is slashed. If they are already slashed, they gain hatred of you.

blurb.content: You drop your guard, and wait for foes to take the bait.

subcontent.content: You may rush 1, then each adjacent foe deals 1 piercing damage to you, as if damaging you with an ability. You then deal 2 damage, once, for each foe that damaged you this way to all adjacent foes, to a maximum of three times.
Then, you may shove all affected foes 1 towards or away from you.

blurb.content: No matter how hard pressed, your hands, feet, and armor are ready to retaliate.

subcontent.content: Gain unstoppable and counter until the end of your next turn.
While this ability’s effect is active, you can rush 1 as an effect if you are damaged by a foe’s ability, but no more than once a turn.

blurb.content: When you come at a knave, you best not miss.

subcontent.content: When you enter this stance or when it refreshes, gain the following interrupt until the start of your next turn:
Refresh this stance when a foe damages you or an adjacent ally with an ability.
Also gain vigor equal to your gamble result after this ability resolves.

blurb.content: You give into the heat of battle, becoming a creature of violence and instinct.

description.content: • You gain hatred+ of the closet foe to you at the start of your turn or when you enter this stance. If multiple foes are equidistant, you may choose.
• You gain vigilance +1 at the end of your turn.

subcontent.content: On entering this stance, you may gain 2 vigor per status affecting you, including from this stance.
You may refresh or exit this stance at the start of your turn.

blurb.content: Grappling is a common and brutal strategy among the knaves, who will happily hurl their foes into trees, rocks, or their own allies.

subcontent.content: Shove an adjacent foe in a full circle either clockwise or counter clockwise through each space around you, phasing through characters. Stop and collide if your foe would hit an obstruction.
Your foe takes 2 damage once for each foe or ally they pass through, to a maximum of 3 times, and those characters are shoved 1. Then, shove your foe 1.
Shove your foe 1 space, then 1 additional space for every character they passed through instead, to a maximum of 4 extra spaces.

blurb.content: Swatting interlopers out of the way, you make it your personal vendetta to make someone’s day as miserable as possible.

subcontent.content: Choose a foe at or further away than range 4.

Each time that foe damages you or an ally with an ability, you may rush 1, ending closer to them if possible, then you may shove any adjacent character 1. This effect can activate any number of times. If you start your turn adjacent to your marked foe, deal fray damage to them, stun them, and then this mark ends. You may also end it at the start of your turn.
Choose a foe at or further away than range 2.

blurb.content: There’s nothing that can’t be solved with the liberal application of fists to faces.

subcontent.content: An enemy adjacent to you rolls a save and you see the result.
The enemy must re-roll the save, keeping the second result.
The character rolls the new save with +1 curse.

blurb.content: Crush your foes and see them driven before you.

subcontent.content: Bleak Mercy gains true strike and ignores defiance, armor, and vigor if its target is suffering from 3 or more statuses.
Cure yourself, then shove all foes in range 2 1 space in any direction.

blurb.content: It is not enough to rudely and plainly strike your foe down. One must make it entertaining.

subcontent.content: Dash 3, then dash 1 space to the side of your movement. This movement ignores all movement penalties and has phasing. However:

description.content: • You must move as far as possible.
• You cannot move diagonally during this movement.

blurb.content: Get the party started.

subcontent.content: in range 2. You may dash 1 after summoning each bomb.
If you end your turn without attacking, you can then immediately gamble to detonate all bombs.

blurb.content: A blur of cape, a flash of color, the gleaming of blades.

subcontent.content: Gamble, then dash that many spaces +2 in a whirling dance.

description.content: • You must move as far as possible before an obstruction causes you to stop.
• You must make all movement in the same direction.
• You cannot move diagonally using this movement.
• However, you can interrupt Spinning Top with any number of other abilities without causing the movement to end.

subcontent.content: If you move the maximum distance rolled by Spinning Top, gain evasion until the start of your next turn.

blurb.content: A shard of Divine Death, summoned with a snap of the finger.

subcontent.content: Gamble, then count the spaces out from you along the line. The space rolled is the attack space.
Character explodes in a large blast area effect centered on them, dealing fray damage.
Death deals 999 divine damage instead to your attack target if they are at 8 hp or less.

blurb.content: The power of Divine Death flows through you, empowering your strikes.

subcontent.content: Set out a d6 power die, starting at 1. While in this stance:

description.content: • When this stance refreshes, or when you or an ally anywhere misses or is missed by an attack, tick the die up by 1.
• When the die is at maximum, you may reset it to 1 when you or an ally uses an ability to empower it. The ability deals bonus damage and triggers any slay effects, hit or miss.

subcontent.content: This stance refreshes at the start of your turn.

blurb.content: The Fool’s arsenal is deep, their mirth infinite, and their ability to turn nearly anything into an explosive is legendary.

subcontent.content: You throw an explosive mine into a free space in range 3. When any character enters the space, the mine explodes with a medium blast area effect centered on it. When activated, gamble to see the effects, which stack. Then, the mine is destroyed, ending the terrain effect.
Yourself and allies in the area fly 1. Foes take 2 damage.
Yourself and allies also gain stealth.

blurb.content: The Fool knows how to move unseen, slipping through shifting faces and voices like a fish through water.

subcontent.content: An character uses an ability against you, and there’s a willing ally in range 3.
Swap places with your ally, teleporting both of you, and the ability targets your ally instead. If you or your ally can’t make a valid teleport, this interrupt can’t be made.

blurb.content: A snap of the finger summons the fool’s cross, the mark of the Laughing God, writ in hellish flames.

subcontent.content: The attack space of this ability is your choice of one of the four edge spaces of the blast.
Deal 2 damage, once, to all foes in the area for every foe or ally in end spaces of the cross, including the attack space.
Cross counts as having +1 foe in an end space.

blurb.content: Laugh at time itself.

subcontent.content: Mark self or an ally in range 2. While marked, that character can use the following interrupt:

blurb.content: Shoot with your heart.

subcontent.content: Your next ability with a listed range gains unerring, +1 boon on attacks, and rebound.
Gain stealth after the ability resolves.

blurb.content: With your heavenly chain skillfully whirling through the air, you dispense divine justice.

subcontent.content: Your foe is marked. While marked, at the start of your turn, if they are in range 3, they take 2 unerring damage from you as bolt of celestial lightning shoots between you. If they are at exactly range 3, increase damage to 2 damage, twice instead.

blurb.content: When skillfully used, the astral chain can be used to maneuver in the blink of an eye.

subcontent.content: Mark and grapple on to a foe, ally, or summon in range from you with an ethereal lasso and gain the following interrupt while that character is marked. You can take the interrupt regardless of distance.

blurb.content: The world goes still, and is split by a bolt of lightning.

description.content: End your turn and gain Stance:

subcontent.content: When you take this stance, or when it refreshes, you may dash 1 and your next attack triggers all exceed effects, dazes your foe, and gains unerring.
Refresh this stance after you score a finishing blow.

blurb.content: With a glint in your eye, you zero in on a foe with preternatural accuracy.

subcontent.content: Choose a foe in range 3 and become immobile until the end of your current turn. At the end of that foe’s next turn, if they’re in range 3 of you, you may dash 2, and the effect ends. If they’re at range 4 or higher, they take 2 unerring damage from you twice, ignoring cover.
Showdown can be used as free action if you activated an exceed effect or scored a critical hit this turn.

blurb.content: You rapidly fire a massive barrage from your weapon into the air. The projectiles hover in the air like hunting eagles, waiting to strike.

subcontent.content: You score a critical hit or trigger an exceed effect.

You shoot out a flurry of projectiles into the air, where they hover in place, creating a small blast terrain effect in range, which can overlap characters. Foes that start their turn in the area that end their turn outside of the area are struck by a projectile, taking 2 unerring damage and dazing them. The area lasts until this ability is used again.

blurb.content: The ultimate freelancer technique - using the soul aether of their companions to supercharge astral bullets.

subcontent.content: Allies are immune to damage from this ability. If it passes through two or more allies, automatically triggers all exceed effects.
Attack target explodes with a large blast area effect placed centered on them. Foes inside take 2 damage and are blinded. Blinded foes take 2 damage twice instead.

blurb.content: By the power of darkness.
You mark your foe with a dire seal. Shadowy tendrils reach out from an unknown space and jerk them like a puppet.

subcontent.content: Flick an umbral seal at a character in range 3, marking them. While marked, once a round when you teleport, you can also teleport the marked character 1 spaces and deal 2 damage to them if they’re a foe.
When marking a bloodied character, immediately trigger the effect, ignoring the round limit.

blurb.content: From beneath a cloak, out from flying sleeves, or hidden in coils of hair - infinite blades. One more sweep, and shadowy bolts of cloth cut through your foes like razors.

subcontent.content: After this ability resolves, create a pit under your attack target. The pit is also a

blurb.content: Draw out a fragment of true darkness, roaming and hunting for warmth.

subcontent.content: Until the start of your next turn, you gain aura 2. You may consume a
in the aura when you or any ally in the aura is targeted by an attack to grant evasion against that attack.

blurb.content: Using forbidden scroll techniques, you confuse the senses of foes and allies alike.

subcontent.content: Choose a character other than yourself in range, then a different character other than yourself in range 3 of that character. Swap their places, removing and placing them. Allies swapped gain stealth. Foes swapped are dazed.

blurb.content: You split echoes of your soul into clones that overlay your movements.

subcontent.content: You create shadowy copies of yourself, granting a d4 power die, starting at 2. If the die ticks down to 0, end this stance. While in this stance:

description.content: • When you use an ability that targets a foe, you may trigger any finishing blow effects of that ability, then tick the die down by 1.
• After you tick the die down, you may teleport 1.

subcontent.content: Refresh this stance if you end your turn with no foes adjacent. When you do, tick the die up by 1.

blurb.content: You step through the air, emerging from the shadow of your foe, where they find only gleaming knives.

subcontent.content: and choose a foe in range. At the end of that foe’s turn, as long as they’re in range 3, teleport to any space adjacent to them and deal 2 damage, three times to them and inflict blinded. Reduce this damage to just 2 damage if they have an adjacent ally. Then, you may kick off them and fly 2.

blurb.content: You capture a thin silver thread of spilled life force of a foe and use it to tear open a space of night and cold.

subcontent.content: You trigger a finishing blow effect.
Mark a small blast centered on that character, then create a terrain effect in the area. All spaces of this terrain effect are
This area lasts until this ability is used again.

blurb.content: The thirteenth scroll art, a void-sheathed blade that cuts away at the aether of the very soul, leaving a cut that creates slashed darkness.

subcontent.content: Mark your foe. While marked, if any foe ends their turn adjacent to your marked foe, or your foe ends their turn adjacent to any other foe, then both the target and any adjacent foes take 2 damage and are dazed. This effect can only trigger once per round.
Immediately trigger the mark effect, ignoring the round limit.

blurb.content: Your strike is a clarion call to the forest, the plains, and the deep places of the Green, bringing forth their denizens to fight for you.

subcontent.content: in an adjacent space to your target after the attack resolves.

blurb.content: With catlike reflexes, you pounce, spurring allies to action.

subcontent.content: Dash up to 2 spaces, then deal 2 damage to an adjacent foe.
An ally or allied summon in range 3 of your foe may also dash 2. If that puts them adjacent to your target, they also deal 2 damage to them.
You and all chosen allies or summons gain stealth after this ability resolves.

blurb.content: Ten palm strikes with the heel of the hand or the haft of the axe will shatter even the most tenacious bark.

subcontent.content: If you’re adjacent to your foe, dash in a full circle clockwise through every adjacent space to your foe, phasing through allies or allied summons, or as far as possible until stopped. Each time you pass through an ally or summon’s space, deal fray damage to your foe, up to a maximum of four times. Stop if you would enter the space of a foe or obstruction.
Increase initial dash to 5. After the ability resolves, you may shove your foe 2.

blurb.content: Call on the beasts of the deep mists and rains, whose form is shadow and water.

subcontent.content: Create small blast misty cloud in free space in range, with the following effects:

description.content: • The spaces of the area always cost a maximum of 1 movement for you and allies to move across, and characters have phasing while moving this way.
Clouds created with this ability last until this ability is used again.

subcontent.content: At the start of your turn, you can consume a cloud as a free action to condense it into a fey creature, summoning a
in any of its spaces and ending this effect.

blurb.content: With a bellow or a clenched fist, you summon an immense spirit to pound your enemies.

subcontent.content: You mark a foe in range. Once a round, at the end of that foe’s turn, a rampaging spirit beast, charges in from any edge of the battlefield. Create a line area effect drawn from the edge of the battlefield that includes your foe. The beast charges down the line until it enters an adjacent space to your foe, shoving all characters 1 to either side of the line.
Then the beast deals 2 damage to your foe, shoves them 1, then coalesces into a real creature, becoming a
Foes affected take 2 damage after this ability resolves.

blurb.content: Your senses sync with those of the herd, and you strike as one.

subcontent.content: • When entering this stance, or when it refreshes, summon a
in free space in the aura, then you and all allies and summons in the aura may dash 1 space.

description.content: • Foes in the aura take +1 damage from summons.

subcontent.content: Refresh this stance at the start of your turn.
While adjacent to 3 or more summons, the action cost of this ability is reduced to 1.

blurb.content: You open the greenways to your allies, allowing them to step the branch-paths and cross distances in an instant.

subcontent.content: Create a leafy portal object in a free adjacent space. At the end of your turn, create another portal in a free adjacent space. Portals last until this ability is used again. Portals don’t provide obstruction and can’t stack or be stacked on other objects.
each time you create an underway this turn.

blurb.content: You call in the winged warriors of the sky to smite your foes.

description.content: End your turn and gain Delay:

subcontent.content: Your next turn must be slow. At the start of that turn, you summon a massive flock of winged beasts that lashes out at all characters in range 2. Yourself, allies, and allied summons in range can dash 2, then gain stealth. Foes in range are shoved 2, and are blinded.

blurb.content: Dip your weapons in the toxins of the deadliest creatures to roam the deep green. Mere preparation of this technique requires years of ritual, patience, and training.

subcontent.content: Your target is injected with a catalyzing toxin. At the end of their next turn, they take 6 damage. Reduce this damage to 3 if they end that turn adjacent to an ally. Then, this effect ends.

blurb.content: You ring the bell of purity and a tone rings out that soothes the peaceful and chastises the violent. A second ring from the bell shatters the tone from the first, breaking open the earth.

subcontent.content: Cure a character in range 2 of that foe.
Grant 3 vigor to all other characters of your choice in range 2 of your foe.

blurb.content: You ring the bell of fleeting guardians, and an ally feels their step lifted by invisible wings.

subcontent.content: Mark an ally in range. That character gains a blessing and can fly 2. Whenever you spend a combo token, your marked character can fly 2.
That ally gains two blessings instead.

blurb.content: You sing a passage of the days of chaos and battle, where the tumult of the battlefield was like the churning of the sea, and divine lightning scathed the land.

subcontent.content: Remove all characters in the area, then place them back in any other space in the area.
Increase area to Large Blast, and allies in the area gain 4 vigor.

blurb.content: You pose, then deliver a striking performance that resonates through the soul.

description.content: End your turn and gain Delay:

subcontent.content: your next turn must be slow. At the start of that turn, you deliver a stunning performance, affecting a small blast area effect centered on you. Foes in the area take fray damage twice and are sealed. Sealed or Pacified foes are shoved 1. Allies in the area are cured.
If you are damaged by a foe’s ability before the start of that turn, the area becomes a medium blast. If you are damaged again, it becomes a large blast.

blurb.content: You sing of the comfort of companions, and the dawn that surely will follow.

subcontent.content: You fly 1, then whisk an ally in range away with powerful winds, removing them from the battlefield and placing them in any space adjacent to you.

blurb.content: You ring the bell of thresholds, creating crystalline fragments of the ancient power that courses through the Chant.

subcontent.content: Remove up to four blessings from characters anywhere to create pulsing motes of energy that descend, creating terrain spaces in free space on the map. None can be placed adjacent to each other or overlap.

description.content: • Any character that enters an affected space or starts their turn there detonates the mote, removing it and creating a small blast explosion as an area effect, centered on them. Foes inside take fray damage, and allies inside gain 2 vigor.
• If the character was yourself or an ally, they are blessed and can fly 1. If that character was a foe, they also have a pit created under them.

blurb.content: You radiate an aura of such powerful peace that all close to you, monster or man, find it impossible to raise a hand in violence.

subcontent.content: When you take this stance, you have aura 1. All characters (including yourself) in the aura gain +1 curse on attacks and take 1 divine damage each time they deal damage to another character.
Refresh or exit this stance at the start of your turn.

blurb.content: Some chanters also study the Book of Ages, the great mythic chronicle of heroes from the time of the Doom. This unorthodox text inherits some of their ability to sing the chant, granting it tangible power.

subcontent.content: Sing a short passage from the book of ages. At the end of your turn, gamble and consult the following table to see which tale you sing. The song resonates in the air until this ability is used again. Yourself or allies that complete the described course of action from the song passage are blessed at the end of their turn they complete it and may fly 2. Characters can only fulfill this condition once per song.
Roll one extra d6 when gambling and choose any result.
Reduce a character to 0 hp or reduce them below 50% hp if above.
Move more than 4 spaces from your starting point on your turn.

description.content: 3.) A Tale of Green and Pleassant Times:

subcontent.content: End your turn adjacent to an ally.
Use an ability on an ally.

blurb.content: You ring the bell of true names, forbidding your foes in august tones against harming an ally.

subcontent.content: Choose either yourself or an ally in range. Until the end of your foe’s next turn, if they damage any character chosen with an ability, they take 1 divine damage three times at the end of that turn. Whether this ability triggered or not, this effect then ends.
Choose yourself and an ally in range.

blurb.content: You throw out a poison seed that bursts into thorny death.

subcontent.content: You foe is marked. When marked, and after you attack your marked foe thereafter, bless yourself or an ally in range 3 of your target.

blurb.content: Blow magical spores in the air, which are disturbed by the chaos of combat. Where they fall, the fruit of life and death blooms.

subcontent.content: Mark a character in range. Once a round after that character ends their turn, create a
If that character is bloodied, repeat this effect. Foes are additionally pacified.

blurb.content: Vine and root coil through the deep soil, bringing forth the restless dead.

subcontent.content: When you enter this stance, or when it refreshes, summon a
in free space in range 2. While in this stance, you have aura 2, with the following effects:

description.content: • At the end of your turn, you may consume any blessing tokens in the aura to summon one thrall in the aura per blessing consumed.
• At the start of your turn, you can prevent up to three thralls in the area from collapsing into plants.

subcontent.content: Refresh this stance once a round when you trigger a slay effect.

blurb.content: You swing with a blade as bright as the new moon.

subcontent.content: Foes take Fray damage. Allies are blessed.
for each foe in the area, and deal 2 piercing damage again as an area effect to those foes.

blurb.content: The wilderness boils with explosive growth, fed by the blood of the battlefield.

subcontent.content: Grow a medium blast area of undergrowth, with its center space in range. The area is dangerous terrain for foes and disappears if you use this ability again.
As long as you are in the area, summon a thrall in or adjacent to the area at the end of your turn for each of these conditions you fulfilled this turn:

description.content: • Sacrificed as part of an ability
Each condition can only trigger once.

blurb.content: Leaves shrivel. Hair Curls. Wounds fail to heal.

subcontent.content: Mark a foe in range. While marked, that character cannot be cured, cannot gain or benefit from vigor, and gains +1 curse on saves. If that character is at 25% hp or lower when marked, they also lose defiance.

blurb.content: You release a rapidly growing seed of the Thornwillow, the blood-fatted plant of the harvesters whose sap is a powerful intoxicant.

subcontent.content: Mark a character in range. At the end of any turn that character took damage, or after they attack, set out a d6 power die or increase the die by 1. When the die would tick to 6, consume it. The marked character sacrifices 6, but then gains 6 vigor, deals bonus damage with all abilities, and becomes unstoppable until the end of their next turn.
When the die is consumed, summon a
and pass this mark to a new character of your choice in in range 3 of the original character. You must pass the mark if possible. If there are no valid characters, the mark ends.

blurb.content: You cast out a handful of aether-feeding fungi, holy spores that grow into a ringed garden of colorful and deadly mushrooms.

subcontent.content: End your turn and create a ring of mushrooms, a burst 2 (self) terrain effect. The ring can be created overlapping any terrain and underneath characters. While the ring is active, gain the following interrupt. The ring lasts until this ability is used again.

blurb.content: The blade edges of the harvesters are so sharp they can cut the very soul.

subcontent.content: Cut away a part of the target’s soul, choosing a free space in range 3 of your foe. If the foe is not occupying that space at the end of their next turn, they take 2 piercing damage, are pacified, and summon a

blurb.content: Divine energy infuses you, allowing hammer-like blows that would fell a demon with even your bare hands.
Bind an enemy in an astral seal, condemning them and crushing them under the weight of their own evil.
Swing your weapon in a flaming arc that sends sprays of fire in bright displays, lighting up the sky.

Many sealers carry portable shrines to the local spirits, adding on talismans, images, icons, or offerings to whichever small god holds dominion over the areas they travel through. In a pinch, they can set these shrines down and beseech the spirits for aid.
You throw out a handful of glittering salt, scorching the spiritually impure.
With a word and a quickly drawn talisman, you stomp your foot and forbid your foe from taking another step towards you.
You place a holy seal over your ally, enveloping them in divine protection.
Invoking the spirits of the land and air, you move at impossible speed, doling out blows faster than the eye can see. A second blow scatters your foes and whisks away your allies.
This aptly named technique can be used to deliver an extremely powerful blow - but focusing the body’s aether in such a way takes a long time to recharge.
A flash of bright color, and a card is stuck to your foe, bursting into arcane fire in a flash.

You flick a beautifully illustrated ethereal card onto the battlefield, laden with the threads of potential. You flick a beautifully illustrated ethereal card onto the battlefield, laden with the threads of potential.
You call down the heavens themselves on your foes.
A distant glint in the heavens, portents of the devastation to come.
You bend a character’s fate, reversing causality so that the very ground warps under their feet.
Causality unmakes itself around you, as wounds heal instantly.
No blurb.
You struggle against fate itself, undoing causality and defying the stars.
You invoke the ultimate power of the tower card, sealing a foe’s fate. In short order, untold calamity befalls them.
Power curls into a writhing ball in your hand, before it's unleashed on your enemies.
You carve a burning rune of power into the very ground beneath you.
A flash scorches the eyeballs, and a thin line burns through rock, flesh, and armor.
You stoke the furnace with the very essence of your being.
You link the soul Aether of you and a companion with a chain of pure fire aether, drawing from the strength of one to bolster the other.
You crystallize ambient Aether with force of will, forcing it to take a useful form.
You burn away the air itself, creating a sucking void that rips your foes into its howling embrace.
Taking a page from the geomancers, Enochians can send a pulse of fire aether into the earth itself, causing tectonic upheaval.

You burn and condense your own aether into super condensed form, creating a crackling black orb that inflicts maximum destruction. Without the time to stabilize this attack, its use can rip away your very life force.
The earth splits, excising poison from its depths, belching poisonous metals and gases.
The earth is an old friend to geomancers, and will allow them passage as easily as slipping into water.
The stomp of a foot or the slap of a palm is magnified a hundered fold into rumbling death.
Striking deep into the earth, a wave of strength resonates with the very terrain around oneself.
The key of creation is turned, and the land is shaped like clay, as the Titans once did.
Like the deepest magma in the earth's crust, your flesh becomes more stony when struck, eventually becoming covered in a gleaming obsidian shell.
Using your knowledge of innumerable anatomies, you quickly rearrange energy channels in your target to heal them - forcefully.
In a flash, flesh becomes unyielding stone.
You hit your target with a pressure wave, setting up lethal vibrations in their body that are strong enough to crack the earth beneath their feet.
A thousand needles of light, each striking a perfect blow.
You thrust your weapon skyward, and pierce the heavens.
You summon a blade of pure lightning energy, sweeping it in a shining arc.
You summon the highwinds to batter your foes.
You charge your target with unstable magnetic energy, causing unstoppable attractive force.
You slash a line of rampant multicolored lightning aether, a blinding arch of light that can carry you or your allies to safety.
A weapon of pure lightning energy impales itself into the earth, flying froma a phantom arsenal, and crackling with potential.
You transmute yourself and your gear into pure lightning Aether, coursing through the boundaries between worlds in a moment.
Agile and alert, your swordcraft spells doom for your foe. When they go to retaliate, you were never there.
You pull an enormous weapon made out of pure ice out of the air, and hurl it through foes.
The stormbenders can ride swells of water as easily as any terrestrial steed. For those not as gifted, the experience is less pleasant.
You shoot a spear of frozen water aether at your foe, stirring up ambient water aether in the air.
You awaken the water aether lying dormant in the land or sea, causing it to surge up in a vigorous burst.
The stormbenders are friend to breeze and gale, and have learned how to coax the wind into doing their bidding.
Better get your sea legs.
Better get your sea legs.
You grab the reigns of the storm and pull it to earth, causing a rippling tornado of water.
A storm of vigorous tunder and acid rain descends at your command, but the center remains calm.
